title: personal-website1
text:
Hi! I‚Äôm Kimberly (or Kimi!), a student at UCLA double majoring in Statistics/Data Science and Economics and minoring in Data Science Engineering. Passionate about data-driven impact, I‚Äôm actively exploring opportunities in data science, fintech, crypto, trading and related fields. I have many goals in life but my main one is simply to live an interesting one!
After an incredible Summer 2025 internship at Coinbase in NYC, I‚Äôm returning as a Sales, Trading & Prime intern in Summer 2026! I love the innovative and collaborative work culture, and I truly enjoy my role scope (it is a bit hard to explain, but think of it as a disruptive-in a good way-intersection of data science, finance, and crypto!).
When away from the computer, you can find me exploring cafes and restaurants in LA, SF, or NYC! I love matcha and coffee and also run my own food blog, frequently working with small restaurants/cafes and matcha businesses. I‚Äôm currently working on a project stemming from my blog (launching December 2025‚Ä¶!) so feel free to stay updated and check out my social ‚Äúmicro micro micro influencer‚Äù life @kimicomida on Instagram :)



Coinbase 2025 NYC Institutional Summit

title: Academic & Personal Projects - Data, Consulting
text:
Built an end-to-end recommendation system that curates personalized caf√© suggestions across Los Angeles using real-world Yelp API data. Designed data pipelines to scrape, clean, and structure thousands of reviews, applied sentiment analysis to extract user-experience signals (ambiance, quality, service), and implemented pricing heuristics to balance value and convenience. The tool outputs ranked recommendations optimized for user preferences, with a focus on matcha quality and location efficiency.
View my project presentation!



Conducted a controlled experimental study to evaluate how caffeine and alcohol impact fine motor performance using a randomized factorial design. Designed and executed a 3√ó3 two-factor ANOVA experiment comparing beverage type (water, caffeinated sports drink, vodka) and dosage (0, 1, 2 units), with age and gender included as blocking variables to control for demographic variability. Analyzed coordination outcomes from 162 participants using R, performed residual diagnostics to validate model assumptions, and visualized interaction effects through boxplots and interaction plots. Findings revealed no statistically significant effect of drink type or dosage, but a meaningful gender-based difference in coordination variability‚Äîhighlighting the importance of demographic controls in performance-related research.



Analyzed food insecurity trends across Somalia, Kenya, and Tanzania using the World Food Programme‚Äôs Global Food Prices Database. Investigated how price fluctuations in staple foods (maize, rice, beans) correlated with regional droughts, conflict, and infestations by integrating time-series data with historical event analysis. Built data visualizations to compare cross-country affordability over time and conducted a structured data critique to evaluate limitations in economic representation, purchasing power assumptions, and demographic bias. Findings highlighted climate volatility and political instability as key drivers of food price inflation, with Somalia experiencing the most severe disruptions.

title: Academic & Personal Projects - Data, Consulting
text:
Consulting

Microsoft‚ÄìUnity Acquisition Strategy - M&A, Cloud Gaming

(FINALIST) Altman Solon x UCLA Consulting Case Competition
Conducted a strategic and financial analysis of Microsoft‚Äôs potential acquisition of Unity to evaluate growth opportunities in cloud gaming, AI-driven development, and the open metaverse. Assessed Unity‚Äôs business model, developer ecosystem, and global market positioning alongside Microsoft‚Äôs strengths in Azure, Xbox, and enterprise software. Built a valuation and ROI model projecting a 19% return over five years, analyzed TAM/SAM/SOM for cloud gaming, and benchmarked against precedent transactions including Activision Blizzard and Zynga. Developed an execution roadmap addressing regulatory risk, integration challenges, and global expansion strategy across Asia and Europe.



Netflix Growth Strategy ‚Äî Converged Media & Interactive Streaming

Bain & Company x UCLA Consulting Case Competition
Ideated and designed strategy project proposing Netflix‚Äôs expansion beyond traditional streaming into converged media experiences. Designed three growth initiatives‚ÄîLearn Mode (in-platform educational features), Netflix: The Experience (pop-up live events), and NextPlay (live sports gamification)‚Äîto improve engagement, diversify revenue, and grow international viewership. Developed a financial model projecting $700M+ in annual revenue from Learn Mode, evaluated market trends in live events and advertising, and assessed competitive positioning across Apple, Amazon, and ESPN. Delivered strategic recommendations supported by consumer behavior research, industry benchmarking, and revenue forecasting.



Bumble Asia Expansion Strategy
Developed a market entry and growth strategy for Bumble‚Äôs expansion into Asia, focusing on high-potential cities including Tokyo, Mumbai, and Seoul. Conducted market sizing and revenue forecasting using industry growth projections, subscription behavior data, and competitive benchmarking to estimate a $347M‚Äì$902M revenue opportunity. Analyzed cultural fit, regulatory risk, and competitive dynamics across regional markets, and proposed a localization strategy centered on Bumble‚Äôs women-first positioning. Built a phased implementation roadmap covering product localization, marketing execution, and customer acquisition, with a focus on converting freemium users to premium through features such as Bumble BFF and Bumble Bizz.
